perturbation.original_text: Upon the agreement of all Parties and the unanimous consent of the Board of Directors, an application to extend the Contract Term may be made to the Examination and Approval Authority no less than six (6) months prior to the expiration of the Contract Term.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon the agreement of all Parties and the unanimous consent of the Board of Directors, an application to extend the Contract Term may be made to the Examination and Approval Authority no less than one (1) month prior to the expiration of the Contract Term.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the application period for contract extension to one month prior to expiration may violate procedural requirements. The Examination and Approval Authority in China needs reasonable time for review and approval, and the shortened period is unlikely to comply with regulations, potentially jeopardizing the extension.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Regulations on Sino-Foreign Equity Joint Ventures
